Posts.Title: What does an infection of the LE arm look like? marymi marymi

Posts.Content: marymi wrote: I have two areas on my arm that are warm to touch, slightly raised and about 3 by 3 inches. I feel lousy also. Is this celluitis? I called my PCP and they can't get me in till tomorrow at 3 and said I should be ok till then. Is that true? Help Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What does an infection of the LE arm look like? marymi marymi

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2006 01:10PM marymi wrote: I went to the ER and they gave me Keflex to start with, and said to monitor my temp and to see my doctor tomorrow. I am glad I did not wait, thank you so much.
Posts.Title: What does an infection of the LE arm look like? marymi marymi

Posts.Content: marymi wrote: I had it a month ago and thought I was all clear after a course of clindamycin, but I week ago Wednesday my fever shot up past 103 and my le arm broke out with red welts everywhere and swelled way up. My PCP took one look and called had me admitted for IV antibiotics. I got to stay for a week. I guess it is time to come out of denial and take this condition seriously. I have found a new LE therapist closer to me and hopefully can see her next week. I have time because my PCP has not cleared me to return to work and am on short term disability. I know I am rambling, but who knew this would be so hard? My arn looks huge and the healing areas make it look like leprosy. I don't know how I am going to keep from getting infected over and over because I have psoriasis on my finger tips and the skin breaks at least one spot a day. My dermatologist does not seem to take LE seriously, so I guess I need a new one. Time to stop whining I guess. Thanks for listening. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cellulitis -again! marymi Lindy101

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2006 07:51AM marymi wrote: So, I thought I was the only one who found that nasty orange color ugly. I am sure if I were African-American, I would find the black equally unnatural. However, the black one does match more of my work clothes, so I ordered one, My fitter thought I was al little loopy, but hery, I have to wear the darn thing.
Posts.Title: The October 2 issue of People Magazine marymi rrs

Posts.Content: marymi wrote: Has an article about Elizabeth Edward's bout with BC. What I found strange is the following "Today, although plagued by lymphedema-numbness in the hands and feet that is a common, ofter lifelong effect of lymph removal - she is cancer free" Lymphedema is numbness in the hands and feet?! I am I missing something here? And we wonder why we have to explain and explain and explain. Log in to post a reply
